meanings.sent1: After searching the entire house, he found bubkes in the old attic.
meanings.sent2: She thought she had lost her keys, but in reality, there was bubkes in her pocket.
meanings.sent3: The magician claimed to make the coin disappear, but in truth, he had bubkes up his sleeve.
meanings.sent4: The empty treasure chest held bubkes, disappointing the pirates.
meanings.sent5: The abandoned town had bubkes left except memories of the past.

meanings.definition: Bubkes: something of no value or significance
meanings.sent1: The broken toy was considered bubkes by the children.
meanings.sent2: He worked hard all day but received bubkes in return for his efforts.
meanings.sent3: The fancy jewelry turned out to be bubkes, just cheap imitations.
meanings.sent4: Her apology meant bubkes to him after all the hurtful words.
meanings.sent5: The old vase, once thought valuable, was now worth bubkes at the antique shop.
